CSSPrimitiveValue.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The CSSPrimitiveValue interface derives from the interface and represents the current computed value of a CSS property.

blockquote.para:
This interface was part of an attempt to create a typed CSS Object Model. This attempt has been abandoned, and most browsers do
not implement it.
To achieve your purpose, you can use:

remarks.para: This interface represents a single CSS value. It may be used to determine the value of a specific style property currently set in a block or to set a specific style property explicitly within the block. An instance of this interface might be obtained from the method of the interface. A CSSPrimitiveValue object only occurs in a context of a CSS property.

Conversions are allowed between absolute values (from millimeters to centimeters, from degrees to radians, and so on) but not between relative values. (For example, a pixel value cannot be converted to a centimeter value.) Percentage values can't be converted since they are relative to the parent value (or another property value). There is one exception for color percentage values: since a color percentage value is relative to the range 0-255, a color percentage value can be converted to a number (see also the interface).

CSSPrimitiveValueGetStringValue.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The getStringValue() method of the
interface is used to get a string value. If this CSS
value doesn't contain a string value, a is raised.

blockquote.para:
This method was part of an attempt to create a typed CSS Object Model. This attempt has been abandoned, and most browsers do
not implement it.
To achieve your purpose, you can use:

CSSPrimitiveValueGetFloatValue.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The getFloatValue() method of the
interface is used to get a float value in a specified
unit. If this CSS value doesn't contain a float value or can't be converted into the
specified unit, a is raised.

blockquote.para:
This method was part of an attempt to create a typed CSS Object Model. This attempt has been abandoned, and most browsers do
not implement it.
To achieve your purpose, you can use:

CSSPrimitiveValueGetFloatValue.returns: A float value in the specified unit.

CSSPrimitiveValueGetRGBColorValue.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The getRGBColorValue() method of the
interface is used to get an RGB color value. If this
CSS value doesn't contain a RGB color value, a is raised.
Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the
interface.

blockquote.para:
This method was part of an attempt to create a typed CSS Object Model. This attempt has been abandoned, and most browsers do
not implement it.
To achieve your purpose, you can use:

CSSPrimitiveValueGetRGBColorValue.returns: An object representing the color value.

CSSPrimitiveValueSetStringValue.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The setStringValue() method of the
interface is used to set a string value. If the
property attached to this value can't accept the specified unit or the string value, the
value will be unchanged and a will be raised.

blockquote.para:
This method was part of an attempt to create a typed CSS Object Model. This attempt has been abandoned, and most browsers do
not implement it.
To achieve your purpose, you can use:

CSSPrimitiveValueSetFloatValue.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The setFloatValue() method of the
interface is used to set a float value. If the property
attached to this value can't accept the specified unit or the float value, the value
will be unchanged and a will be raised.

blockquote.para:
This method was part of an attempt to create a typed CSS Object Model. This attempt has been abandoned, and most browsers do
not implement it.
To achieve your purpose, you can use:

CSSPrimitiveValueGetRectValue.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The getRectValue() method of the
interface is used to get a rect value. If this CSS
value doesn't contain a rect value, a is raised.
Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the
interface.

blockquote.para:
This method was part of an attempt to create a typed CSS Object Model. This attempt has been abandoned, and most browsers do
not implement it.
To achieve your purpose, you can use:

CSSPrimitiveValueGetRectValue.returns: A object representing the rect value.

CSSPrimitiveValueGetCounterValue.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The getCounterValue() method of the
interface is used to get the counter
value. If this CSS value doesn't contain a counter value, a
is raised. Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the
interface.

blockquote.para:
This method was part of an attempt to create a typed CSS Object Model. This attempt has been abandoned, and most browsers do
not implement it.
To achieve your purpose, you can use:

CSSPrimitiveValueGetCounterValue.returns: A object representing the counter value.

CSSPrimitiveValuePrimitiveType.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The primitiveType read-only property of the
interface represents the type of a CSS value.

blockquote.para:
This property was part of an attempt to create a typed CSS Object Model. This attempt has been abandoned, and most browsers do
not implement it.
To achieve your purpose, you can use:

CSSPrimitiveValuePrimitiveType.value: An unsigned short representing the type of the value. Possible values are:
